description: Horse chestnut (Aesculus hippocastanum) is an amazing species of tree. Not only is it attractive, with its white flowers in spring and dark green, hand-shaped leaves that turn yellow in fall, but it also has many practical uses. The fruit of the tree is a brown, spiky casing that encases a shiny bean-like seed which contains saponins, natural soaps that have many benefits, such as lowering cholesterol. The wood is also strong and water-resistant which makes it an ideal wood to use in construction, furniture and carvings. Horse chestnuts may also be used for medicinal properties, such as soothing skin irritation and rashes. Its majesty and practical nature make it an amazing species.
